titleStmt.title: To the right honourable the Lords and Commons in Parliament assembled. The humble petition of divers well-affected magistrates, ministers, citizens, and other inhabitants in the city of London, and parts adjacent.

To the right honourable the Lords and Commons in Parliament assembled. The humble petition of divers well-affected magistrates, ministers, citizens, and other inhabitants in the city of London, and parts adjacent.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Annotations on Thomason copy: "July 5. 1648."; "made by mr Nie, for ye Independents, in opposition to what ye Common Counsell, and Commanders had offered ye parliament, [illegilbe] (and called ye Cross-Petition)".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
